comments.text:
Say you have a Linux machine and you want to try out any of the development builds like Aurora or the Nightly. One easy way to get it is from www.mozilla.com/firefox/channel/

You will get a 32bit Fx build from that site, and when you run it on this machine the navigation buttons back/forward disappear.

This is a Linux 64bit machine running Ubuntu 11.04. It doesn't happen on Linux 32bit 10.10. We should be offering the 64bit version of Fx from that site where appropriate, and find out why this isn't working here.

Nominating for tracking because this makes trying out our development builds on linux more confusing. I should say the Fx4.0.1 32bit build also doesn't show the back/forward buttons on this environment.
comments.author: jbecerra@mozilla.com
comments.creator: jbecerra@mozilla.com

Dao - have you heard about this kind of theme bustage before?

(We should first confirm that I haven't sent us on a wild goose chase - do we actually support linux 64 in a meaningful way? Should we just warn off users who come to us that way?)

comments.raw_text:
(In reply to comment #4)
> (We should first confirm that I haven't sent us on a wild goose chase - do
> we actually support linux 64 in a meaningful way? Should we just warn off
> users who come to us that way?)

The FTP dir seems to have both i686 and x86_64 builds: http://ftp.mozilla.org/pub/mozilla.org/firefox/nightly/latest-mozilla-aurora/

It seems we have builds for both architectures for both Aurora and final Firefox releases, but the download buttons on mozilla.com always default to i686, since it can be considered the lowest-common-denominator that should work on both architectures.

I'm running the x86_64 version of Fedora 15 here and the i686 build of Aurora works fine for me.

Perhaps the original issue described here is a product bug rather than a website bug.

juanb: what version of Linux are you running?

If this looks familiar then you may be remembering bug 621962.

Can someone tell me the name of the package that provides /usr/lib32/libgtk-x11-2.0.so.0 on Natty, please?
And what does that link point to?

It would be helpful to know whether other 32-bit GTK apps have the same issue, but I don't know which app to suggest.  Does chromium use GTK/Gnome icons?
